ul_7373: #!/usr/bin/env bash

for flashpid in $(pgrep -f flashplayer.so); do
    cd "/proc/$flashpid/fd"
    for video in $(file * | grep '/tmp/Flash' | sed 's/\(^[0-9]*\).*/\1/g'); do
        echo "/proc/$flashpid/fd/$video"
    done
done

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_7373: Where are stored the Youtube videos cache in Google Chrome?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_7373: #!/usr/bin/env bash

for flashpid in $(pgrep -f flashplayer.so); do
    cd "/proc/$flashpid/fd"
    for video in $(file * | grep '/tmp/Flash' | sed 's/\(^[0-9]*\).*/\1/g'); do
        echo "/proc/$flashpid/fd/$video"
    done
done

Explanations about Options.-f:
The pattern is normally only matched against the process name. When -f is set, the
 full command line is used.

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1062825: Networkmanager should use another DNS Server in VPN Tunnel
Top-3 Scripts:
au_1062825: #!/bin/bash
UUID='uuid-of-vpn-connection-file'
VPNIF="$(nmcli -t connection show "$UUID"| sed -n '^GENERAL\.DEVICES:/{s/^[^:]*:\([^\s]*\)}/\1/;p}
[[ "$1" =~ ^tun -a "$2" = 'up' ]] && systemd-resolve --set-dns xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx --interface "$VPNIF"
